TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The Temporary "First Contract Edition" Thread

Articles.Content:
While it's no longer practical for Squad or the KSP devs, I enjoyed Ye Olde Tymes when releases would be sudden and out of the blue. They were a happy, wonderful surprises that would appear from nowhere like a good gift.

Elegant releases, for a more civilized era.

Now we have the escalation of the company logos being released

Urge to constantly refresh KSP homepage: Rising.
I know right: I'm itching for a devnote.
I feel like potentially in the next few hours, the Devnote will determine what I do this weekend.
I doubt .24 is gonna be out after only a week in experimental phase. However I dont mind being wrong.

I doubt .24 is gonna be out after only a week in experimental phase. However I dont mind being wrong.

Shuush you, don't jynx it. This is why we cant have nice things.
Ah, my bad.

Didn't you hear its coming out tomorrow and its moving into multiplayer testing and they are adding 100 new parts and also resource gathering and extra solar systems. Also deformable terrain with meteor showers and real time impact craters. Also zombie Kerbals are spawned in the new cities that are now created with the new terrain system.

Also Sarcasm....
Don't play with my emotions. I'm in a very frail state right now.

Didn't you hear its coming out tomorrow and its moving into multiplayer testing and they are adding 100 new parts and also resource gathering and extra solar systems. Also deformable terrain with meteor showers and real time impact craters. Also zombie Kerbals are spawned in the new cities that are now created with the new terrain system.

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

I would pay $80 for this game.

And no......I am not being sarcastic.

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

I would pay $80 for this game.

And no......I am not being sarcastic.

The beauty is, it isn't $80, therefore you can buy multiple copies for all your friends. Which I encourage you to do. Its one of the first games in a while that's fun, with endless re-playability and its very intellectual.

The beauty is, it isn't $80, therefore you can buy multiple copies for all your friends. Which I encourage you to do. Its one of the first games in a while that's fun, with endless re-playability and its very intellectual.

While I agree 100% with your statement, I was referring to the game frizzank described. Most particularly the meteor impacts and Kerbal Zombies.
I'm a little slow. I'll show myself out.
Where's the new devnote???
IT takes them.......some time, normally i don't get to read the devnotes till Wednesday.....even thou i live in west Virginia....not that far from mexico...2 three times zones....I think.

Where's the new devnote???

The dev notes usually don't come out this early, probably another two or three hours from now, which I think is three hours after you posted.

Somewhere around 5:30 PM right now in Mexico. I think. So, for them it's still Tuesday. If your working on a international scale it's always tricky where you home town and or time line is based on.. But indeed it passed the "stereotype" business hours. Even for them on there timezone. So asking about it makes sense since they do everything else between the business hours of there timezone. Weekends are still weekends. Etc Etc. They would never dare to put out a update after business hours/in the weekend. Because of the stereotype reasons. Long story short, I agree. There late..

Edited July 1, 2014 by JSD
It probably wont come out for a few more hours.
It's getting pushed out now. Should be on the forum shortly.
Thanks guy. Crossing my fingers for an action packed 4th.

Thanks guy. Crossing my fingers for an action packed 4th.

You know the dev notes are already out, right? Look at Tumblr:)
What's a tumble? I'm an old man of 30.

It's up on the main site~!

Good stuff.
Hmmph. It hasn't been this delayed in being pushed to the forum in a while. Well, just be patient, I guess. It's coming here. It's already up on Tumblr and Reddit.
